events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 28th, resulting in significant front-end damage to the car.
The claim was reviewed and classified under 'Auto Accident' due to keywords in the customer’s description.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the case and coordinate further processes.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged by the insurance company.
Agent requested the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver’s license for further review.
Customer provided all requested documents including the official police report and several detailed accident photos.
Investigation team began assessing the vehicle damage and reviewing all submitted evidence related to the accident.
The investigation concluded with a full assessment report confirming liability of the other driver in the collision.
A settlement amount was proposed covering all damages and repair costs as per the investigation findings.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the efficient handling of their claim.
Insurance company formally approved the claim and authorized the payment based on the agreed settlement.
The payment was successfully issued to the customer’s designated bank account covering the repair costs.
The claim was formally closed following full reimbursement and customer confirmation of claim resolution.
All claim files and documentation were archived securely for future reference and compliance requirements.
